Data Processor¶

class neural_pipeline.data_processor.data_processor.DataProcessor(model: torch.nn.modules.module.Module, file_struct_manager: neural_pipeline.utils.file_structure_manager.FileStructManager, is_cuda=True)[source]¶

Class, that get data from data_conveyor and process it: 1) Train or predict data 2) Provide monitoring (showing metrics to console and tesorboard)

load() → None[source]¶

Load from checkpoint

model()[source]¶

Get model

predict(data) → object[source]¶

Make predict by data :param data: data in dict :return: processed output

class neural_pipeline.data_processor.data_processor.TrainDataProcessor(model: torch.nn.modules.module.Module, train_config: TrainConfig, file_struct_manager: neural_pipeline.utils.file_structure_manager.FileStructManager, is_cuda=True)[source]¶
get_lr() → float[source]¶

Get learning rate from optimizer :param lr: target learning rate

get_state() → {}[source]¶

Get model and optimizer state dicts

load()[source]¶

Load from checkpoint

predict(data, is_train=False) → torch.Tensor[source]¶

Make predict by data :param data: data in dict :param is_train: is data processor need train on data or just predict :return: processed output

process_batch(batch: {}, is_train: bool, metrics_processor: AbstractMetricsProcessor = None) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Process one batch of data :param batch: dict, contains ‘data’ and ‘target’ keys. The values for key must be instance of torch.Tensor or dict :param is_train: is batch process for train :param metrics_processor: metrics processor for collect metrics

save_state() → None[source]¶

Save state of optimizer and perform epochs number

update_lr(lr: float) → None[source]¶

Update learning rate straight to optimizer :param lr: target learning rate
